info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 21 at 5:27PM EDT until May 21 at 6:30PM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 630 PM EDT FOR NORTHWESTERN RICHLAND...HURON...SOUTHEASTERN SENECA... SOUTHWESTERN MEDINA...NORTHERN ASHLAND...NORTHEASTERN CRAWFORD AND SOUTHWESTERN LORAIN COUNTIES... At 527 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Willard, or 16 miles southwest of Norwalk, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect damage to trees and power lines. Locations impacted include... Grafton, Willard, Wellington, New London, Plymouth, New Washington, Savannah, Polk, Sullivan, Lagrange, Penfield, Pittsfield, Greenwich, Attica, Spencer, North Fairfield, Bailey Lakes, Tiro, Rochester and Nova. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
